reviews.review_msg: Best prof I've had at Beedie so far. He gives excellent lectures and gives fair tests. He records all his lectures which helps out when reviewing material. It is not mandatory to attend his lectures however it pays off if you do as he will test you on material brought up in class.

Sasha is one of SFU's greatest profs. You can tell that he genuinely cares about students' learning and makes efforts to ensure we understand. His lectures are easy to follow and his use of real life examples are extremely helpful. He records his lectures, so in-person attendance is not necessary. Highly recommend taking a class with him.

Sasha is a really good professor with real-life experience to complement his course content. Exams are very fair as well as the grading. It is essential to pay attention in the lecture, as Sasha outlines questions that will be on the exam, so you can prepare better. The final is not cumulative.

Sasha was one of the best profs I have ever had at Beedie. He really cares about the students and at end of semester he encouraged us to add him on Linkedin and stay in touch. What helped me study was going through his slides and TA 's slides and talk about the concepts and application to my friends. Jordan (TA) was also super helpful (and cute).

Sasha has been my favourite prof by far during my undergrad. His lectures are engaging and gives many examples. Because the midterm and final are both 40%, his lectures are extremely important to take note of the examples he gives as theyre easy to understand and can be used in exam questions.
Great professor

Jordan is great at explaining concepts with clear examples. His concise slides make the material easy to follow. The course had fair exams (70%), a straightforward group presentation (20%), and participation (10%). He was super accessible and kind - even responding to emails all-day before exams. Highly recommend!

One of my favourite instructors I've had so far, James makes sure to keep the class as engaged as possible by providing examples from his own life as a lawyer and even provide hints on how to do well in his exams. To succeed in his class, get ready to do lots of practice case questions.

So James lectures are based out of the modules he presents, you will have to read through text material if you are looking for good grades. He's definitely able to create a real connection of the law with examples from corporate business structures. There's a lot to memorize, think like a corporate lawyer.

Easily my favourite professor throughout 4 years of Beedie. Hilarious, like laughing out loud in class hilarious. 

There is a lot to memorize, you need to read the textbook every week. But James' lectures & anecdotes will clear any confusion.

For the students who say he is sometimes rude - it's not malicious - keep in mind that Pflanz is first and foremost a real practicing lawyer, and second, a lecturer at SFU. He deals mostly with real-world legal issues and actual clients, whereas SFU keeps their students in a bubble. It comes from a place of wisdom, experience, and some humor :)

Amazing at communicating and clarifying tough law concepts. Answers questions directly and succinctly. Lectures are interesting, but can go quickly. Only downside was 20% participation marks as tutorials often ran out of time before everyone could participate. Exam questions were fair, if you studied a fair amount. Very practical. Would recommend!
Very hard exams.

Really nice professor, he is able to communicate the concepts in a fun way using real life examples. His exams are very fair but really have an issue with the time. Also, grading the presentation and participation could be clearer. Average is quiet high so study well. Other than that, he's a great prof and I would take him again.

Solid prof, but very annoying system. At the start of the semester, we were told that in tutorial we just had to show up and say something and the participation section that was worth 20% would have been an easy 100. Then they changed it last minute after everything was done to lower the grades. Very slimy and cheap in my opinion. Online sucks.

Hard professor! Online course is extremely hard. He usually rushes at the end because he has no time left. Poor time management! Should thoroughly explain all concepts. Tests are extremely hard with little to no time. Expects us to write 5 paragraphs answers with 30 MC and an essay in an hour. Horrible!!

He's an awesome professor that's really interesting when he gives lectures. There's no homework, but just one small presentation that easy. He gives hints during lectures about what's going to be on the exams and what to pay attention to when studying. Everything is based off the textbook, so make sure to read!

He is an amazin prof. could be intimidating but he knows what he's talking about. You must attedant lectures to get a better understanding of the concept. The final and midterm are super easy if you pay attention in class and do all the reading. Best prof and best class. Highly recommend.

The way James teaches can be intimating for many students because James speaks in a very serious tone, and frequently questions the students on tough legal concepts. The surplus of information makes his class difficult, however James provides hints of exam questions throughout the semester and you should know those ones very well to get good mark.

Textbook is your best friend for this course. Make sure you know all the terminologies, concepts, and you'll do fine on the midterm and the final. James explains the concepts very well in the class, so make sure you attend the lectures. BUS 393 isn't a GPA-booster, as he makes you work for it. Also, the TA is incredibly cute and stylish.

Excellent prof! Very knowledgeable and explanations are crystal clear. Also encourages questions. Midterm and final were more than fair. Easy MC and fill in the blank. Case questions are very manageable if you understand the material. Read the book, go to tutorial, and ask questions if you're unsure! Easy A

As James mentioned in class, for ESL students, this course gonna be a tough course,  this is so true for me. Read through the textbook, and take notes wisely, and attend the office hours. James is very nice and always prepared to help. It is a challenging but the most valuable course that I have taken so far.
Hard exams, funny lectures, and a cute TA. His tutorials are really good, he's very knowledgeable.
Hard exams, funny lectures, and a kinda cute TA.
James is really funny. He keeps the class engaged and delivers the material well.  Easily one of the best professors at SFU. Be ready to participate in tutorial.

He's a great prof, study his powerpoints and refer to textbooks for larger concepts. As long as you listen, understand the concepts and do the readings this course is a breeze! James is also good at clarifying questions if you're confused, and makes the class funny with his examples!
He is a hilarious professor who keeps students engaged with great real life examples. Exams are very fair and he mentions exactly what he is looking for in class. Highly recommended
I would highly recommend James. Lectures are very entertaining and he helps make the course material interesting.
I enjoyed the class and found it useful.

James is a great professor. The course is very information dense so in lectures he will tell you if a topic is important or not. There is an easy individual presentation in tutorial and participation is required. On exams, MC and fill in the blank are easy, and paragraph and essay questions require you to apply the concepts you learned to a case.

James is the best professor that I have had in my 3 years at SFU, hands down. Attend the lectures as he gives hints on what material will be tested. PARTICIPATE every tutorial and you will get a good grade. His exams are okay, multiple choice are easy, however long answer is hard. He mainly tests lecture slides, study them and you will do well.

OK class, not very difficult. Not really necessary to attend lectures. Everything is off the textbook. Basically you have to memorize the bolded terms on the textbook and you'll do fine. The presentation was annoying and the TA's grading of it was very subjective. But for exams it's not bad.

James is a great prof, he gives lots of examples that relates to the materials. Midterm was very hard (50.3 average), final was easier but the overall class average was below 60. On the other hand, the curve saved us.

He is a great professor. very helpful. I still go visit him whenever i have a legal concern and he always helps his students as much as he can. exams were fair. you need to read the textbook and slides.
Great Prof. Genuinely wants and encourages his students to succeed. Study the textbook well and you'll do well in his course. Attending office hours helped a lot. MT and Final were fair.
James is very helpful. His good sense of humour makes lectures fun and interesting. Plus, his TA Christian is da BOMB. I

I definitely recommend that you take BUS 393 with James because he is by far one of the most helpful profs in the entire business faculty. His lectures are mostly based on course readings but he'll occasionally integrate his own legal experiences into his lectures. The midterm average was relatively low but the class is curved so it doesn't matter.
James makes the law class more interesting than the subject entails. He knows commercial law very well. Exams are fair but quite detailed. Study a lot. One individual presentation in the tutorial.

Interesting course. Love the topics I learned. James is blunt and hilarious-he tells it like it is. Read everything in the textbook TWICE. I found the study guide useful 4 studying.  I wish there were more law courses in the Business degree I'd def take them especially with James!
He was really helpful and accessible.

James is a great prof that brings with him real industry experience and a sense of humour. He once complained that no one on ratemyprof has said he's "cute" yet, so I'm just putting it out there that "he's cute" so his life can be complete.
Awesome prof, keeps lectures interesting with humour! Fair marker, and really friendly and approachable! I highly recommend him!
Awesome prof, really helpful. Midterm and exam were somewhat hard since they are mostly textbook based and the book is pretty content-heavy.

This was a great prof, I wasn't to keen on law before this class, but he brings his experience to class, and he also adds a bit of humour. Make sure you talk in tutorial and for his tests read through atleast once.

For his first semester, I thought he was really good. He makes an effort to remember names but doesn't play favorites, he wants everyone to do well. Very accommodating and open to suggestions. Lectures were a kinda right out of the textbook, but he keeps it interesting. Tutorial/presentation is easy, midterm and final were not hard. I RECOMMEND HIM
good prof. lectures enjoyable but disorganized. no point really taking notes just sit back and try to absorb the material. midterm/final were long but marked fairly.

Funny and relatable. However, he does not follow his powerpoints or textbook at all. It can be very disorganized and confusing. He did give us the option of an take home exam or in class, and we chose take home. The grading criteria is very vague and ambiguous. Tough to actually satisfy.

Robin gives interesting anecdotal lectures, but does not go over important key terms. He also changes his test criteria based on student feedback. Constantly adjusting our expectations (open book? closed book?) was very stressful. I'd urge him to just decide one thing and stick to it.

Awesome professor. I would love to take a class with him again. Explains the concepts very properly. The examples he uses in the class are great. He is very clear about what he expects in the midterm and final exams.

Robin is an amazing prof. His classes are hands down the best I've had at Beedie. Classes are interesting because of his energy and enthusiasm and he gives lots of interesting examples to help you understand the concepts. The exams and quizzes are about the stuff he discussed in class so if you show up and pay attention you should be fine.
He doesn't explain the concepts well and expects us to know everything for the quizzes and exams.

Take it with him, if you want to ruin your GPA. The worst class I had in Beedie. His quizzes are not fair, the questions are like very long and hard. Doesn't explain the concepts well. Changes the course outline during the semester.

Robin Elliott does not use the textbook at all. He is so lazy he makes the class mark MC quizzes in class. He grades the midterm and assignment really tough, you have to go really in depth even though he says he just wants a short summary. The final was brutal as you had to write 6 short and 3 long answers but there were so many points to cover.
Awesome teacher! His lectures are great, clear and  funny.   It took forever to get marks back, but other than that, great course.
Exams are very fair, and the annotated lecture slides and casebook are all you need to succeed in the course. Both of the TAs for this course were great as well.

Absolutely loved him. Most useful class beedie has to offer. After the first lecture, I was genuinely interested in the content and he relates it to real life examples. 100 min 100 question midterm and final which was straight forward if you go through his voice recording slides. 20 min tut presentation was not bad at all. 10/10 prof

Robert was a great prof. He had slides with audio on each one to explain further. Exams were 100 marks and 100 minutes, so around 80 questions, and one group presentation around 20 minutes, which can be a bit crazy, but they were fair and no surprises and clear rubric. No textbook, all you need to succeed are the slides. Best option to take.
Pretty good prof. However, he talks too slow. Please talk faster! Record the whole lecture as a video rather than voice messages on powerpoint.

Robert is such a fun guy and just an overall fantastic prof. He really cares about his students. There was 1 midterm, and in-class final, and tutorial presentation. The exams were pretty fair and if you read  and listen to his annotated slides, you should do well in the course
Really nice guy and took a lot of his time to help out students

course was fun because Robert tries to keep it light and interactive. Crazy exams though. 100 marks 100 mins but you also need to read cases to questions. Robert makes some amazing slides. Has his voice recording explaining what's happening in each slide, thats helpful. Tutorial presentations were chill

Robert is a great BUS 393 professor if you want to learn how to deal with real life scenarios about law and how the law applies to business then he is the professor to take. He uses real life application to make the content easier to understand and remember. The most useful course beedie has to offer.

Robert is a must take for BUS 393. He makes law interesting. The entire class is application to real life and you are not tested on remembering legal jargon. Definitely the most useful course I have taken in Beedie.

The course content is interesting, but the way the class is set up makes things challenging. If you care about your grade, I would recommend watching the annotated PPT slides (most important study resource) BEFORE the lecture even though they are very time-consuming. Exams are not too hard (90% short answer, 10% MC), but it is a massive time crunch

The most boring professor I've ever had in Beedie. His lectures are unorganized and since its going back to in-person, he couldn't get more engagement from the students as he kept one slide on the screen and spoke for 2 hours.

Robert is a great professor if you come to class prepared. Don't expect for him to spoon feed you course material, you MUST prepare before class to follow the lectures. He spends lectures applying the course material to real life situations, and promotes student engagement.

Boring lectures, and hard exams. His exams are open book, but his notes don't cover any materials tested on the exam, so why would he even bother making the exam open book. Not enough time on the exam, nobody finished. Some people only reached 60/80 questions . Gotta read the textbook, and attend lectures or else you'll get a bad mark guaranteed.

While this class does not have many graded components, the way the evaluations are set up makes it more likely than not you will succeed. Some questions on exams can be answered in 1 sentence, and they are very straight forward. The presentations also have criteria that is hard to mess up. A very well run class, would recommend Robert to all!

Professor Adamson genuinely cared for his students during the pandemic, and adapted his class (reduced examinable material) in the second half based on student feedback. Exams are long but straightforward, as they are based on his lecture slides and the cases he brings up. I liked that he covered a breadth of law/strategy topics in his course.
Robert made the class very interesting/relevant. I learned a lot in this class and i'm happy i took it with Robert. 10/10 prof
Made class fun by using relevant/interesting case studies. Excellent lecturer- definitely recommend. Tests are tough but come straight from his lecture.

Nice prof but made the midterm so that it was impossible to finish in 2 hours. Questions were somewhat similar to what was covered in class but not enough time to carefully analyze and think about response. The lectures are messy and there are no clear guidelines given to what is expected. Really hard to get a decent grade. Avoid at all costs!!

UNFAIR especially he deliberately creates extra long midterms and finals which are hard to pass and type. WORST PROF I have ever come across. This class was taken during COVID - He's not helpful. He was unorganized when it came to describing the syllabus and his syllabus was not as per summer long weekends. Totally not supportive.

During COVID- Robert required a lot of time when it came to studying. This means that his annotated slides added up to at least 3-4 hours and you cannot fast forward through them. He tests heavily on the information in the annotated slides. On top of this are the actual lectures and weekly readings. Only perk, the lectures were asynchronous.

Hands down the WORST PROF at Beedie!!! He's so not helpful at all and wicked inside his mind. He is genuinely crazy and he does not care about his students. Totally not supportive and understanding. UNFAIR especially he deliberately creates extra long midterms and final which he intends to make every student to fail! Give him a F!

Hands down the BEST PROF at Beedie!!! He's so helpful inside and outside class. He is genuinely concerned about his students and is so supportive and understanding. Just know the slides thoroughly and I promise you will be fine. WE NEED MORE PROFESSORS LIKE HIM!!!

This class is practical and goes beyond just business. Robert is a great lecturer when tying law concepts with real-life cases. The midterm was all written and long, but fair. Grading was just based on midterm, presentation and final. I found it helpful when taking 393 and 381 together because some of the concepts overlapped

Charismatic, kind, and invested in his students success. Students may say lectures are mandatory because of the level of detail he provides in-person versus on his slides. However, I attended only two lectures the entire semester and pulled off a decent grade with minimal studying. Got to pick our groups for the presentation which was great.

If you listen to him, read his slides, and then understand them, you will do fine. Midterm and Final is straight forward as he likes to call it, "no surprises." However the content can a little bit dull sometimes but I think that is more personal than anything. Great prof, I would definitely recommend him.
This is a very practical course. Robertson does a good job of teaching concepts so you don't forget them once the class is over.

Great Prof, his lecture is knowledgable and covers most of his exam questions. You will do great if you remember almost every definition and concept on his lecture notes during the midterm and final exam. However, to do better, you need to fully understand the ideas his taught during lectures and ask ta or him if you dont got the point.

Robert drills business law concepts into your head. You will not forget the material for the exams because he repeats himself so much. This is slightly annoying during lecture but so helpful in the end. Even if you do the bare minimum you should still be able to do well if you attend lecture. Text is supplementary but very useful. Bell curved.

Adamson was probably one of the best profs in beedie. He focuses on his lecture notes, so dont need to buy textbooks. He was extremely helpful in his office hours, and response to email questions very thoroughly. His exams are quite easy, just be sure to read the case examples he gave  in his lecture slides.

RA is a great prof, better than he gets credit for. Tips for success? attend lecture, read the casebook, know his slides backwards and forwards and you will do amazing. Actually wants his class to do well. Expect to cover 4-6 topics in depth instead of 12 at a surface level. Don't expect to be rushed. Great guy, great prof.

Best Prof at SFU. He cares about what he teaches and he wants you to succeed. He constantly reminds his students that hes not out to trick them. Probably one of the nicest and most knowledgeable guys  that SFU has the limited ability of supplying. Id strongly recommend taking it bus 393 with him over shafik. Really fun lectures.

His slides and lectures are extremely wordy and consist of him asking questions yet rarely providing answers.  Lectures are good to attend, to find out what the exams will cover, but the book was where the majority of my learning came from.  What could be communicated in 2 sentences, Robert will use 25.

Robert seems very passionate about class but sometimes he goes on ridiculous tangents and spends an hour on one slide alone because he goes into unnecessary detail about something irrelevant. The midterm only consisted of 1 and a half chapters because he wasn't able to cover the material fast enough before the midterm. I would not recommend him.

Great prof - interesting lectures, relatively easy exams. Don't get caught up in lengthy explanations in exams -  his exams are really long - & ask you questions that test your surface knowledge rather than a deeper understanding of law concepts.
This is an amazing prof! His exams were extremely fair if you studied! He seems like a cool guy, and I wish I had taken the time to talk about his legal knowledge outside of lecture!
Fair but very long exams. Read the textbook and memorize all the terms and you will do well.

very nice and helpful prof as he responds to emails very quickly and is very detailed in his replies to your questions. lectures are indeed quite boring, and reading the textbook is a must. but overall, he is a nice prof to take the course with.
If you have any difficulties just go and see him! he is very helpful in person.

Class was rewarding, sometimes the lectures would seem to drag on but the material was interesting. Tutorials were alotta fun, Mark's best TA. Also not much work just 1 presentation, 1 midterm, and 1 final. Would recommend because Rob is a good prof and doesn't bury you with work giving you a chance to breathe and really grip the material.THUMB SUP

Interesting course material, but lectures might get boring bcuz he keeps repeating the same topic for 2 weeks.Fair exams with few easy MCQs and LOTS of short answers. Focus on memorizing the notes and understanding the cases that he discusses. MT took me longer time to study for than the final.Presentation was fun. Easy A+ :)

extremely helpful professor. He knows exactly what he's talking about and he always takes time to help students with anything, even questions not involving class material. Exams are fair, must know the concepts inside and out, his notes are more of an overview, so you must read the book which is very good. Overall a good class with a great professo
He teaches very practical stuff, so if you want to actually learn the real world commercial law, take it with him.

He's a nice guy.. but a really bad teacher. He will explain the simple concepts (and get stuck on one slide) for almost 30 minutes, and skip through slides that have hard topics. The textbook was good so I learned everything there instead. His exams are very disorganized doesn't give out any practice exam either. Take from someone else if you can.

This course is all about memorizing the textbook. The prof provides good slides and going to lecture isn't necessary, but I guess it helps if you don't fall asleep. While the prof is knowledgeable, it's obvious that he is new to teaching. Tutorials were useless.

If you are looking for someone to tell you what to study and how to study to get a good grade, he is not for you. However, if you really want to now why is law important and how it can relate to every aspect of business go for him. The best prof ever - very knowledgeable, lots of experience, very well organized and loves what he is doing!

I wouldn't recommend taking this class with him.  He's a really nice guy and knows what he's talking about but he's super boring! Also, he marks really weird.  For our presentation he prohibited the TA's from giving out anything above 21/25, and no explanation for why. His midterm was lengthy and the questions were too broad. Avoid him if you can.

Worst professor ever. You can tell this guy is a lawyer who just happens to teach because all he does is blab and hardly even goes through the slides. Really difficult exam. The midterm was so hard they had to bump everyone up 15 - 20% so that half the class didn't fail. AVOID HIM!

he changed his exam style to some f'ed up thing. A 70% essay question that integrates 11 chapters..with lil clarification on what is expected from the exam. MT with 11 chapters closed book...where the other class is open book with only 6 Chapters...JUST DONT TAKE HIM OMG

High interest in the material he teaches. Exams were fair. There's a loot of material but that's just law, not the prof. You don't really need to go to lectures, but it helps in understanding certain concepts. Great prof, take him if you can.
Dno if attending lectures is really necessary.  In my opinion, he goes through easy concepts at a snails pace but I guess this is helpful if you find law particularly difficult to understand.
very good lecturer

Great teacher, great class. His examples are relevant and his ability and willingness to teach is higher than almost all my other profs. His marking is fair and he goes over all exams to make sure the T.A's stay consistent. Take this prof.
Students fall asleep in the lecture, but some example indeed was tested in the exam. Read the textbook and you will be fine. Not too much work load, only a presentation after the midterm.
This guy is the goat. He made fun of the kid beside me all year and it made my day

Shafik made lectures enjoyable. His exams are also very fair. The group project could use more structure/instructions. Will make plenty of jokes which I loved (not for the easily offended). Teaches using examples, which is how you will be evaluated. Will take more courses with him even though I don't need to.
Shafik is a great prof! He is a funny guy and teaches well. Exams are fair as well, just wish you're not on his bad books and don't get bullied every lecture.

Truly the best prof at SFU. Shafik actually cares about your wellbeing and ensures that his class is fair. The topics were so interesting and Shafik's humour made 3 hours feel like nothing. I actually was sad when class was over. Best class I've ever taken.

Best SFU prof ever ! would recommend to anyone who wants to learn and enjoy school! He is hilarious, and great at teaching. You can tell he cares, which is rare to find in a prof. I never write reviews but he is honestly a rare prof, as half the profs at SFU don't care.

Shafik is hands down the best professor at SFU Beedie! He is funny, caring, and engaging. Shafik conveys lecture material clearly and supports the concepts with real life examples. Lectures are intriguing and he always encourages participation. Exams are based on concepts and examples covered in class. Take BUS393 with Shafik, you won't regret it!

Shafik has been one of the best professors I've had at SFU. I highly recommended attending his lectures as the concepts are explained in depth with many examples. He often engages the class to participate and give their opinions on the subject matter. The exams were fair and tested on material covered throughout the slides.

Shafik is the best professor for the Bus393 Commercial Law course. He's been very supportive throughout the semester and the way he keeps everyone involved in the class is excellent and laudable. I'd highly suggest everyone to take this course with him.

One of the best profs I've ever had. His grading scheme and exams are fair and he is good at getting students to understand the material. He's hilarious and it makes going to lecture way more enjoyable. He is very helpful and he really cares about his students and wants to them succeed. Very cool dude and very inspiring.
Great professor, always open to help.
Shafik is the GOAT

I absolutely loved his Crim 1116 ,. It is clear he loves teaching and cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Having access to the lectures online is so helpful, and I really appreciate his exams; they are precisely what he teaches. You can get a good grade if you study his slides, listen to his lectures and attend checkin classes.

Shafik is an amazing prof. He is always accessible outside classroom and he gives 120% respect to everyone. Shafik will also try his best to answer every single question you ask and he will never rush for materials. My only comment is: Please go for him with this course because you will take more than you expected.

Like Shafiq as my teacher very much. His lectures are excellent. Never miss them. He gives lots of examples and he relates the material to stuff we can understand. We finished midterm exam and unlike some teachers he covers only stuff we have covered in class in exam and marks were very fair. He will call you back on weekends if you have questions
the guy starts talking shop the moment you ask a question

Shafik is by far one of my favourite teachers. He is always accessible and wants you to succeed in every way possible. He focuses on teaching until the whole class understands. This means he will never rush his lectures and will dedicate 3 to sometimes 4 classes for one chapter. Make sure to take Shafik if you ever get the opportunity.

I am there at 8:30 a.m. for his class, and on Fridays yeah! I love this prof. His classes are great. He involves you in lectures when he gives examples. Makes things crystal clear. Need more like him. Good luck getting in his class. I waited to get in his class now for 2 semesters and finally
Amazing prof. You'll actually enjoy going to class. I dare you to sit in the front;) haha. Just study examples and terms, you'll do fine. :)

Shafiq clearly loves law by the passion he shows in his lecture. Attending his lectures is like going to theatre and you get a performance. It is like being entertained while you are learning and it is painless:) he is very good. One of my favourite teachers 4 sure.
Best prof I have had at Beedie, hands down. Waiting for the fall semester to have his other course in ethics. Will also take his employment Law course when he teaches.

BEST PROF EVER! Took 393 with him never really studied just went to lecture and took notes, he gives really good examples so you don't really need to study hard for the midterm or final! But all his classes have really big waitlists which sucks! Really wanted to take 303 with him but the waitlist was all filled up. Wish he taught more classes
One of the best professor I have had at SFU. Great entertaining lectures. Read the book to get the harder questions on the exam.
Best teacher I have had at SFU by a mile and a half. I wish I had taken him in Bus 303 because his bus 393 class rocked. He is really good.

Best professor at SFU by a mile. Shafik is engaging and makes the material so interesting to the point where it excites you to go to lectures and learn. Would highly recommend taking any class with the GOAT.

Amazing prof, never missed lecture! Love the way he teaches, everything just sticks with you when you are studying for exams. He has a strict no cell phone rule but overall a really funny and inspiring prof! If your taking 393, take it with him he's the best!

Loved Shafik, he is so great! He is very interesting to listen to since he has lots of passion for law and brings up hilarious examples in class to relate to the concepts he is teaching. Very easy to sit through the lectures because they are super entertaining, don't skip them tho he tests on what he covers in class. Never opened the book

Super duper guy. His lectures are really really good. He tells stories to explain difficult concepts Andy uses examples you can relate to in your own life which makes it understanle. He loves participation and will remember your name if you participate and use you in his examples. I am surprised he remembered my name in a class of 90 students.

Completed midterm exam last night in bus 393- business law with prof. Shafiq. His lectures are amazing. Really! You learn way more from him than the text book. He uses real world examples to make things easier to understand and he does it in a way you understand clearly. The midterm exam was very fair and No surprises if you attended lectures.

Of the teachers I have had, he is no doubt one of the best. He is a lawyer who knows how to speak very well and explain things with examples so that you do not get lost in class. He always asks you if you understand and rarely when you do not he will give more examples and makes sure he does not leave you behind. I wish more were like him.

He is an excellent teacher when it comes to explaining legal concepts with examples you can relate to. He is very available to students. He makes lectures so much fun. He called me back on thebwerkend when I needed help. Waitlists for his class are long.

I had prof Bhalloo in the summer for both bus 303 and 393 in the summer session. I thought he was excellent and consistently great lectures in both classes. I have not seen him teach bus 483 recently but would love to take it when he teaches. He is very good. If you can get in his class good luck as always waitlists.

Shafiks the best teacher I have had at sfu. I never miss his lectures ever ever. I wish the class was not at 8:30 in the morning but I have always made it as he makes the course so very interesting and fun. You learn so much and participate . I think his midterm was very fair. I am in both his bus303 ethics class also and he is consistently good.

Shafik is a great, caring guy. Engaging lectures. The class has gotten harder and isn't as easy to do well in. You're expected to answer beyond what questions are actually asking you to do. Tough to get feedback/explanations from TAs as their answers are akin to "ehh sorry, tough luck".

Agree with the last comment. Shafik is amazing prof. You cannot miss his great lectures in the bus 393 commercial Law class. He involves students in examples in class. He makes it easier for you to understand material and I found his tests fair both midterm and final. He is also very funny and smart. I am in his bus 303- ethics class this summer
